meanings.definition: Happening or existing at the same time
meanings.sent1: The synchronized dancers moved in isochronal steps.
meanings.sent2: The meeting started at an isochronal moment for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The isochronal arrival of the bus and train made commuting easier.
meanings.sent4: Their isochronal heartbeats echoed in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: The isochronal ticking of the clocks filled the room with a sense of unity.

meanings.sent1: The isochronal sound of the dripping faucet was annoying.
meanings.sent2: The isochronal beeping of the alarm reminded him to take his medicine.
meanings.sent3: The isochronal chirping of the birds outside woke her up every morning.
meanings.sent4: The isochronal waves crashing on the shore created a calming rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The isochronal flashes of lightning lit up the sky like a strobe light.
